GLOBAL METAL APOCALYPSE AND NO REMORSE RECORDS (GIBRALTAR) ARE PROUD TO PRESENT:

GMA: GLOBAL DOMINATION VOL 1

From all of us at GMA we thank you for downloading this unique compilation, after around a whole month's worth of planning, executing and gathering of bands to represent their respective metal scene, we hope you enjoy it as much as we enjoyed compiling it. Unfortunately we could not get every scene on this compilation and so we apologise if your scene is not represented, however fear not as at Global Metal Apocalypse, we strive to recognize and cover as many scenes there are from all over the world. We stand for one thing. Total global metal domination.

Our thanks go out to Sherlic White who designed the compilation artwork, Nathan "Ayperos" Colombo who agreed to host future compilations on his No Remorse Records bandcamp site. We also thank all of the bands partaking in this international compilation, you have made it all worthwhile and we hope that you and your fans will be proud of taking part. Finally we thank the bands, labels, PR's, management, etc and everyone involved within the music industry who we enjoy working alongside with.

Rhys thanks:

My family who have always supported me throughout 10 years of blasting metal. Chris 'ginger' Rogers, Berit Hansen, Kees Emnesys, Miranda Yardley, RED Radio, Dr. Michael Bailey, Sam Dunn, Henri Sattler, Sahil Makhija, Kobi Farhi, Chris Motionless, The Defiled, all the media outlets, the GMA readers, The GMA team (brothers and sisters), Iron Maiden, all the labels, PR's, management, etc, Sammy Sayed, Eduardo Chacon, Dez Fafara, Sherlic White, Nathan Colombo, Stephen Spencer, Craig Marsterson and the 6th form crew, Barney Ribeiro, Randy Blythe and whoever I have met or spoken to, sorry if I forgot you! There's not much space here... x

Nabil thanks: 

I would like to thank the people who have always supported me, my mates from Sacrilege, Homicide and my close brothers from Abominable Carnivore, Enmachined, Dissector, Thrash and lastly my editor Rhys Stevenson for the immense support.
